result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Dean McGeshick

records.addlTxt:
9:32 AM Defendant Robert Dean McGeshick in court.  Attorney Megan McGee Norris appeared by video for Robert Dean McGeshick.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Charles James Simono in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 22CF100, 21CF173 and 19CF95. Court - here for FPT on all matters. Court will set all matters for PLEAS on 3/6/23 at 10:00 AM, continues bond.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 6, 2023 at 10:00 am.

Final pre-trial on October 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
and $1500 signature bond.  Kelsie McGeshick is the only person allowed to reside or permitted to be in Mr. McGeshick's home.

1:42 PM Prosecuting attorney Charles James Simono in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert Dean McGeshick appeared by video, in custody from FC jail. Called 19CF95, 21CF73 and 22CF100. Court received status from SPD, that he is eligible, no attorney appointed yet. Will have all cases set for FPT and continues bond. State on 22CF100 McGeshick is asking for reduction of bond. McGeshick agrees and makes bond argument for bond to be reduced. State asks for some bond to remain on case for reasons as stated on the record. McGeshick makes final statement. Court - reduces bond to $1500 cash bond with a $1500 signature bond attached, same conditions. All other cases, bond continues.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Public Defender Status of Counsel Report
Status conference on August 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

3:15 PM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert Dean McGeshick appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Patti l Wabitsch not in court. DAR Court Reporter Lisa Freeman appears by zoom. Court appears by video from Shawano County Courtroom. Called 19CF95, 21CF73 and 22CF100. Court puts on the record that Attorney Wabitsch has filed a motion and order to withdraw as counsel. McGeshick agrees that there was a breakdown in communication. Court indicates SPD has filed a report - they are trying to find an attorney for him, continues bond on each case and will have schedule for STC.
Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
11:10 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert Dean McGeshick appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Patti l Wabitsch appeared by video for Robert Dean McGeshick. Court calls 19CF95, 21CF73 and 22CF100 tracking as STC. 21CF126 here for PH. State is asking for adjournment as witnesses were not subpoenaed. Wabitsch objects to adjournment, ready to proceed. Court dismisses 21CF126 without prejudice. All other cases. Wabitsch will bringing motion on 22CF100 and asks for FPT on all cases and will call for motion date. Court will have all cases set for FPT and also will address motion on that date as well. State if this case is re-filed, summons for that July 25th date. Court agrees and any bond posted in 21CF126 can be returned to the poster.
Final pre-trial scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Final pre-trial on July 25, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

11:05 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert Dean McGeshick appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Patti l Wabitsch appeared by video for Robert Dean McGeshick. Called 19CF95, 21CF73, 21CF126 and 22CF100. Court 22CF100 - Wabitsch has recieved copy of information, waives reading and enters NG pleas. Court makes sure McGeshick is waiving his personal appearance. Court accepts pleas and will have set for PTC. 22CF126 - Wabitsch asks for all cases to be set for PTC and enters NG pleas, would like to address bond on 22CF100. Court - reviews cases no PH was held on 21CF126. Wabitsch has not went over waiver on that case. Court will take up the issue. Wabitsch would like to have PH within 10 days. June 20 at 11:00 AM. Wabitsch would like to address bond on 22CF100. Court will have all cases set for June 20 at 11:00 AM all parties to appear by zoom. Wabitsch asking for reduction of bond suggests $500 cash, makes bond argument. State objects to any reduction of bond for reasons as stated on the record. Wabitsch responds and again asks for reduction of bond. Court - has reviewed case, motion and considered all statements, denies motion and bond will be continued.
Status conference scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on June 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt: of Judge - approved in court

2:32 PM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert Dean McGeshick in court in custody from FC jail.  Attorney Patti l Wabitsch in court for Robert Dean McGeshick. AIA and PH scheduled for today. Wabitsch waives further reading of complaint and would like to proceed to PH. State calls Det Sgt. Michael Short as first witness. Sworn in, 2:33 PM. State directs. Proper identification of defendant, 2:36 AM. Cross-examination by Attorney Wabitsch, 2:41 PM. Witness excused, 2:46 PM. Court based on evidence presented, finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Wabitsch files substitution of judge. Court finds timely and accepts substitution of judge.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on May 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:36 PM Prosecuting attorney Charles James Simono in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert Dean McGeshick appeared by video. Attorney Patti l Wabitsch appeared by video for Robert Dean McGeshick. Wabitsch has not received a copy of the complaint as case was just filed this afternoon. Court advises McGeshick of charges and penalties. Wabitsch would like to address bond and asks for $500 cash bond for reasons as stated on the record. State asks for $5000 cash bond for reasons as stated on the record. Court will reduce bond to $3000 cash, condition Kelsie McGeshick is the only person allowed to reside or permitted to be in the home. Wabitch is asking PH within time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
